title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 68.5 - Payment by retailer
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 68.5 - Payment by retailer

State Regulations

Unless payment for all alcoholic beverages purchased by a
retail licensee during a particular credit period is made on or before the
appropriate final payment date, such retailer shall be deemed to be in default. Where payment is made by mail, the remittance must be mailed on or before the
final payment date. Where such payment is received by the wholesaler subsequent
to the final payment date and the envelope containing the remittance is
postmarked not later than the business day immediately following the final
payment date, the retailer shall not be deemed in default. In such instances
the wholesaler shall retain the envelopes for a period of one
year. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
68.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
